meanings.definition: To support or defend a cause or person
meanings.sent1: She was championing the local animal shelter by volunteering every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The community came together, championing the rights of the homeless population.
meanings.sent3: The cat was championing for more treats by meowing loudly at the pantry door.
meanings.sent4: His actions were championing the underprivileged, shining a light on their struggles.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was championing for equal opportunities for all students, ensuring fairness in education.

meanings.definition: To promote or advocate for something
meanings.sent1: The company was championing their new product through social media campaigns.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours championing the benefits of recycling to her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was championing for more nuts, gathering as many as it could find.
meanings.sent4: The artist was championing a message of peace through their thought-provoking paintings.
meanings.sent5: He was championing for healthier food options in schools, aiming to improve children's diets.
